etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, named after Friedrich Welwitsch (1806–72), Austrian botanist

definitions: a gymnospermous plant of desert regions in southwestern Africa that has a dwarf, massive trunk, two long strap-shaped leaves, and male and female flowers in the scales of scarlet cones. It is remarkable for its ability to extract moisture from fog.

notes.text: Genus Welwitschia, family Welwitschiaceae: one species, W. mirabilis

shortDefinitions: gymnospermous plant of desert regions in SW Africa
